page.title: 19Customs
page.content: It is not surprising that Much Hadham has some mysteries surrounding it. Old Hertfordshire legend has it that the spectral Moat Lady appears every year on St.Valentine's Eve, February 13th. She is said to rise up from the waters of the ancient moat at Moat Farm, near the village of Much Hadham and claim a "victim" from among those who venture too near the moat and come within range of her supernatural powers. This haunting will continue, so the story goes, until someone is intrepid enough to rescue her bones from the moat and give them "decent burial". Other bits of Hertfordshire lore include the beliefs in "Pook's men and witches" and the prudence of "askin' permission o'the wood folk afore puttin' iron to elder.
